benchmark_details.name: EvalDial
benchmark_details.overview: EvalDial is an evaluation benchmark designed to measure dialogue hallucination in large vision language models (LVLMs) by prepending hallucinatory dialogues to original test examples.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To precisely measure the dialogue hallucination of LVLMs and evaluate the robustness of these models in multi-modal tasks.
tasks: Measuring LVLM performance under adversarial conditions
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: EvalDial does not include responses to the prepended dialogues; answers are generated by LVLMs only.
out_of_scope_uses: General NLP tasks not involving visual data

data.source: EvalDial benchmark datasets including ScienceQA, OKVQA, GQA, and others.
data.annotation: Dialogues were crafted based on the relation to image content and context.

methodology.calculation: Performance is evaluated based on accuracy drops and CIDEr scores before and after applying dialogues.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance drop indicates greater susceptibility to dialogue hallucination.
methodology.baseline_results: Zero-shot performance drops of 37.7% for VQA and 59.6% for Captioning tasks were measured.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on six vision-language datasets.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for generating misleading outputs during user interactions.
